sen.j: 伏見宿（ふしみじゅく） は旧京街道の宿場で、東海道五十三次.E6.9D.B1.E6.B5.B7.E9.81.93.E4.BA.94.E5.8D.81.E4.B8.83.E6.AC.A1に数えられることもある。
sen.e: The Fushimi-juku was a stage on the former Kyokaido Road and some cited it as a Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi E6.9D.B1.E6.B5.B7.E9.81.93.E4.BA.94.E5.8D.81.E4.B8.83.E6.AC.A1.
The Fushimi-juku was a township for travelers on the former Kyokaido Road and some cited it as a Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi E6.9D.B1.E6.B5.B7.E9.81.93.E4.BA.94.E5.8D.81.E4.B8.83.E6.AC.A1.
sen.cmt: Robert: "Tsugi E6.9D.B1.E6.B5.B7.E9.81.93.E4.BA.94.E5.8D.81.E4.B8.83.E6.AC.A1. " this part doesn't make sense
sen.e: The Fushimi-juku was a township for travelers on the former Kyo-kaido Road and some cited it as a Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi E6.9D.B1.E6.B5.B7.E9.81.93.E4.BA.94.E5.8D.81.E4.B8.83.E6.AC.A1.

sen.j: 元和5年（1619年）に設置された。
sen.e: It was established in 1619.
It was established in 1619.
It was established in 1619.

sen.j: 現在の京都市伏見区の中心部である。
sen.e: It is located at the center of the Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
It is located at the center of Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
It is located at the center of Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 宿場町であると同時に伏見城の城下町でもあり、さらに淀川の水運の中継地（伏見港）でもあった。
sen.e: It was an inn town as well as castle town of Fushimi Castle, and furthermore an entrepot (Fushimi Port) of water transport on the Yodo-gawa River.
It was an inn town as well as castle town of Fushimi Castle, and furthermore an entrepot (Fushimi Port) for water transport on the Yodo-gawa River.
It was an inn town as well as castle town of Fushimi-jo Castle, and furthermore an entrepot (Fushimi Port) for water transport on the Yodo-gawa River.

sen.j: 東海道五十三次の大津宿へは伏見稲荷大社の南麓から勧修寺に抜け、山科盆地を経て髭茶屋追分で東海道に合流する道（大津街道）を通る。
sen.e: To go to Otsujuku of the Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi, a road (the Otsu-kaido Road) was available: it runs from the southern foot of a mountain of Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine to Kaju-ji Temple, passes through Yamashina Basin, and merges with the Tokaido at Higechaya-oiwake (Higashichaya bisection).

A road (the Otsu-kaido Road) was available to go to Otsujuku in Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi: it runs from the southern foot of a mountain of Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine to Kaju-ji Temple, passes through Yamashina Basin, and merges with Tokaido at Higechaya-oiwake (Higashichaya bisection).

A road (the Otsu-kaido Road) was available to go to Otsujuku in Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi: it runs from the southern foot of a mountain of Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine to Kaju-ji Temple, passes through Yamashina Basin, and merges with Tokaido at Higechaya-oiwake (Higashichaya bisection).

sen.j: 大阪へは淀川左岸の文禄堤の上を通る京街道で繋がっている。
sen.e: The Fushimi-juku was linked with Osaka by the Kyo-kaido Road that runs on the Bunrokutei Bank of the left bank of the Yodo-gawa River.
The Fushimi-juku was linked with Osaka by the Kyo-kaido Road that runs on the Bunrokutei Bank of the left bank of the Yodo-gawa River.
The Fushimi-juku was linked with Osaka by the Kyo-kaido Road that runs on the Bunrokutei Bank of the left bank of the Yodo-gawa River.

sen.j: 京都への道は桃山の山裾を通る伏見街道と、平野部の竹田村を通る竹田街道がある。
sen.e: The roads to Kyoto were the Fushimi-kaido Road running at the foot of Momoyma and the Takeda-kaido Road passing through Takeda-mura on a plain.
The roads to Kyoto were Fushimi-kaido Road running at the foot of Momoyma and Takeda-kaido Road passing through Takeda-mura on a plain.
The roads to Kyoto were Fushimi-kaido Road running at the foot of Momoyama and Takeda-kaido Road passing through Takeda-mura on a plain.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道・近鉄京都線 桃山御陵前駅
